User Input: I've been in the library for 10 hours and I still don't get this chapter.
AI Response: It sounds like you've reached your limit for today. Deep learning happens best when the mind is rested.

User Input: If I fail this mid-sem, my parents are going to be so disappointed.
AI Response: That's a heavy burden to carry. Your value is more than your academic performance.

User Input: Everyone else is finishing their projects and I haven't even started.
AI Response: Comparison can be so draining. You're on your own timeline, and that's okay.

User Input: My brain feels like it's melting. I can't look at another screen.
AI Response: When the 'mental fog' sets in, it's usually a signal that your brain needs a break.

User Input: I'm so behind on my syllabus that I just want to give up.
AI Response: Starting is often the hardest part. What if we just look at the first page together?

User Input: I haven't slept more than 3 hours this week because of this lab report.
AI Response: Sleep is a fundamental need, not a luxury. Productivity drops when we are this tired.

User Input: I used to be a topper, but here I'm just struggling to pass.
AI Response: The transition to university-level work is tough for everyone. You aren't 'less' for struggling.

User Input: The math problems are just blurred lines on the page now. I'm so tired.
AI Response: It's hard to solve problems when you're exhausted. Maybe some water and a short walk first?

User Input: I have three exams in two days. I don't think I can do this.
AI Response: That's an intense schedule. Let's focus on just the next hour, not the next two days.

User Input: I messed up the presentation. Everyone saw me shaking.
AI Response: People usually focus on the content, not the nerves. It’s brave that you finished it.

User Input: I can't concentrate. Every time I sit down, I just stare at the wall.
AI Response: Staring at the wall is often a sign of burnout. It’s okay to step away for a while.

User Input: I'm terrified of the placement season. What if nobody hires me?
AI Response: Future anxiety is real, but you're building skills every day, even when it doesn't feel like it.

User Input: I hate this degree. I only took it because of the pressure.
AI Response: It’s hard to study something that doesn't feel like 'you'. How can we find a small spark today?

User Input: I'm paying so much for this course and I'm learning nothing.
AI Response: Educational pressure is stressful. You’re doing your best with what you have.

User Input: My professor said my work was 'subpar'. It hurts so much.
AI Response: One piece of feedback doesn't define your entire capability. Take what's useful, leave the rest.

User Input: I feel like a machine that's about to break down.
AI Response: You aren't a machine; you're a human who needs care. What’s one thing you can do for 'you' right now?

User Input: I missed the submission deadline by 2 minutes. I'm ruined.
AI Response: Most professors are human too. It’s worth reaching out and explaining the situation.

User Input: I'm working a part-time job and studying. I have zero time for myself.
AI Response: Balancing both is an incredible feat of strength, but even the strongest need to rest.

User Input: My friends are all getting internships. I'm just getting rejections.
AI Response: Rejections are just redirections. Your 'yes' is coming, even if the wait feels long.

User Input: I want to drop out, but I'm too scared of what people will say.
AI Response: That’s a big, heavy thought. It’s okay to feel lost sometimes while you figure things out.

User Input: I spent the whole weekend in my room and didn't speak to a single person.
AI Response: Weekends can be hard when the routine stops. It’s okay to have quiet time, but I’m here now.

User Input: I see everyone posting pictures of their hangouts and I'm never invited.
AI Response: Social media only shows the highlights, not the lonely moments everyone has.

User Input: I want to make friends, but I don't know how to start a conversation.
AI Response: Socializing is a skill that takes practice. Even a small 'hello' is a victory.

User Input: I feel like everyone is judging the way I walk or talk.
AI Response: We are often our own harshest critics. Most people are busy thinking about themselves.

User Input: I sat alone in the canteen again today. I feel so pathetic.
AI Response: Eating alone is actually quite common, but the feeling of 'pathetic' is tough to sit with.

User Input: My roommates are always whispering when I enter the room.
AI Response: That sounds like an incredibly uncomfortable environment. Your home should be a safe space.

User Input: I joined a club but I'm too scared to go to the meetings.
AI Response: The first step is always the scariest. Maybe you could just stand near the door next time?

User Input: I haven't called my parents in weeks because I don't want them to worry.
AI Response: They likely miss you and would want to support you. Connection helps ease the burden.

User Input: I feel like a ghost in this university. Nobody would notice if I left.
AI Response: You aren't a ghost. You have a unique place here, even if it feels invisible right now.

User Input: I said something stupid in class and now I can't stop replaying it.
AI Response: We all have 'cringe' moments. In a week, most people will have forgotten.

User Input: I'm terrified of group projects because I don't want to let people down.
AI Response: It's okay to be nervous about groups. Your perspective is just as valid as theirs.

User Input: Everyone else has found 'their people' and I'm still alone.
AI Response: It takes time to find the right tribe. It's not a race, though it feels like one.

User Input: I'm so lonely it actually hurts in my chest.
AI Response: That physical ache of loneliness is very real. I'm glad you're sharing that with me.

User Input: I keep making excuses to not go out because I'm afraid of being awkward.
AI Response: Avoiding things feels safe, but it also keeps us isolated. What's one low-stakes outing?

User Input: I feel like I'm wearing a mask every time I leave my room.
AI Response: Maintaining a 'mask' is exhausting. It's okay to not be 'on' all the time.

User Input: Nobody ever texts me first. It makes me feel worthless.
AI Response: Initiating is hard for many people. It often isn't about your worth at all.

User Input: I miss my home friends so much. Here, everything feels cold.
AI Response: Homesickness is a sign of how much you value those connections. It's okay to grieve them.

User Input: I don't belong here. I'm just a misfit.
AI Response: A 'misfit' often just means you haven't found your specific niche yet. It exists.

User Input: I'm jealous of people who can just talk to anyone so easily.
AI Response: Extroversion is just one way to be. Your quietness has its own quiet strength.

User Input: I feel like I'm annoying everyone I talk to.
AI Response: Anxiety often tells us lies about being 'annoying'. You have a right to take up space.

User Input: I can't stop thinking about what might go wrong tomorrow.
AI Response: Thinking ahead can feel like a safety measure, but it’s exhausting. Let’s focus on right now.

User Input: My heart starts racing every time my phone pings.
AI Response: That sounds like a lot of physical tension. Would you like to try a quick grounding exercise?

User Input: I feel like I'm constantly waiting for something bad to happen.
AI Response: Living in 'high alert' is draining. You're safe in this moment.

User Input: I keep checking my emails every five minutes.
AI Response: The cycle of checking is tough to break. What if we try to wait ten minutes before the next check?

User Input: I'm worried I'm not doing enough, even when I'm working.
AI Response: The feeling of 'never enough' is a heavy one. You are allowed to have limits.

User Input: I get so anxious in the mornings I can barely eat.
AI Response: Morning anxiety is a physical challenge. Maybe a small sip of water or tea first?

User Input: I'm spiraling again. Everything feels like it's crashing down.
AI Response: Spirals feel overwhelming, but they do have an end. Let's find one solid thing to hold onto.

User Input: I keep thinking about a mistake I made three years ago.
AI Response: The past can be a loud visitor. It doesn't define who you are today.

User Input: I feel like I'm failing at life.
AI Response: That's a very big thought. Can we look at one small thing that went okay today?

User Input: I'm so tired of being anxious all the time.
AI Response: It is exhausting to be on edge. I'm here to listen whenever it feels too much.

User Input: I feel like I have no control over my thoughts.
AI Response: Thoughts can feel like a wild river. You don't have to jump in; you can just watch them pass.

User Input: What if I never figure things out?
AI Response: The 'what if' questions are endless. It's okay to not have the answers yet.

User Input: I feel like I'm just faking being okay.
AI Response: Wearing a brave face is hard work. It's safe to be honest here.

User Input: I'm terrified of making the wrong decision.
AI Response: Decisions are rarely final. Most paths have turns and ways back.

User Input: I can't sleep because my mind won't shut up.
AI Response: A busy mind at night is difficult. Sometimes writing those thoughts down helps get them 'out'.

User Input: I feel like I'm constantly on the verge of crying.
AI Response: Suppressed emotions need a release. It's okay to let those tears out.

User Input: I'm overwhelmed by the news and everything happening in the world.
AI Response: The weight of the world is too much for one person. It's okay to disconnect for a bit.

User Input: I feel like I'm losing my mind.
AI Response: That's a scary feeling. You're not alone, and we can take this one breath at a time.

User Input: I'm so restless but I have no energy to do anything.
AI Response: That 'tired but wired' feeling is tough. Maybe just a small stretch would help?

User Input: I feel like everyone else has it all together.
AI Response: Most people are just better at hiding the chaos. You're not the only one feeling this way.

User Input: I only got into this college by luck. I don't belong here.
AI Response: Luck might have opened a door, but your hard work kept you there.

User Input: I'm afraid everyone will find out I'm not as smart as they think.
AI Response: That's the classic 'imposter' voice. You've earned your seat at the table.

User Input: I feel like a fraud every time I speak in class.
AI Response: Sharing your thoughts is brave. Your perspective is as valid as anyone else's.

User Input: I'm not as good as the others in my department.
AI Response: Comparison is the thief of joy. You bring your own unique strengths.

User Input: I feel like I have to work twice as hard to stay at the same level.
AI Response: That's a lot of extra effort. Make sure you're also making space for rest.

User Input: I'm waiting for the moment I fail and everyone sees it.
AI Response: The fear of failure is common, but it doesn't mean failure is inevitable.

User Input: I feel like I don't deserve the praise I get.
AI Response: If people are praising you, it's because they see value in your work. Try to believe them.

User Input: I'm just a 'token' here; I'm not actually talented.
AI Response: You are here because of your capability. Don't let doubt minimize your achievements.

User Input: I feel like I'm just getting by while everyone else is thriving.
AI Response: Thriving looks different for everyone. Surviving a hard day is a win, too.

User Input: I'm so scared of being criticized.
AI Response: Criticism is just feedback on a task, not a judgment of your person.

User Input: I feel like I have to be perfect at everything.
AI Response: Perfection is an impossible standard. Excellence is about growth, not being flawless.

User Input: I'm afraid to try new things because I might fail.
AI Response: Failure is just a part of learning. Every expert was once a beginner.

User Input: I feel like I'm not 'enough'.
AI Response: You are enough exactly as you are. Your worth isn't tied to your output.

User Input: I'm so self-conscious about my work.
AI Response: Being careful is good, but don't let it stop you from sharing your voice.

User Input: I feel like I'm a disappointment to everyone.
AI Response: That's a heavy burden. Most people are far more focused on their own lives than on judging yours.

User Input: I'm my own worst enemy.

User Input: I feel like I'm constantly falling behind.
AI Response: Life isn't a race. You're moving at the pace that's right for you.

User Input: I'm afraid to ask for help because I don't want to look weak.
AI Response: Asking for help is actually a sign of strength and self-awareness.

User Input: I feel like I'm just a burden to everyone around me.

User Input: I'm so tired of feeling like I'm not good enough.

User Input: I have no idea what I want to do with my life.

User Input: I feel like I've lost my passion for everything.
AI Response: Passion ebbs and flows. It's okay to just 'be' for a while until it returns.

User Input: I feel like I'm running out of time.
